July 30, i962
Dr. Kenneth A. Christiansen
Director of Television
University of Florida
234 Stadium
Gainesville, Florida
Dear Ken:
I don’t know what goes with Rosen, except the University of Illinois was also
interested in the possibility of employing him.
I regret that the report of the Airlie House Seminar came as such a surprise.
Actually, it was discussed at some length in the TV Board meeting and in the meet¬
ing of the big Board at Columbus, which you did not attend.
Nevertheless, you are quite right that anything of this sort ought to be routinely
passed along to the Directors. Accordingly, I am instructing Harold to see to it
that all communiques to Chairmen of Committees are automatically sent to members
of the Board.
The Airlie House conference was a follow-up to the NAEB seminar in Madison.
I felt that the final portion of Kellogg money set aside for seminars might properly
be devoted to assisting NAEB to assist itself. Consequently, I suggested that this
be largely a meeting of the Development Committee expanded by some members of
the Board and key Committee Chairmen, The main purpose was to review the recom¬
mendations from last summer and then see what plans could be evolved for implementing
them.
I look forward with interest to your comments on the report.
Cordially yours,
William G. Harley
WGHipw
